oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anonymous Portrait of Bishop Charles Todd Quintard
Quintard, Bishop Charles Todd
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This head and shoulders image of an elderly gentleman in clerical garb is inscribed with cryptic lettering and the name C.T. Quintard.

After the death of Bishop James H. Otey in 1863, Doctor Charles T. Quintard became the second Episcopal Bishop of Tennessee. During the Civil War, he served as a chaplain and sometimes also as a physician. He was associated with an elite group of Confederate soldiers, the Rock City Guards, organized from Nashville and the surrounding area. After the war, he was appointed Vice-Chancellor of the University of the South, Sewanee, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quintard, C. T. (Charles Todd), 1824-1898 -- Portraits; Episcopal Church -- Tennessee -- Bishops
Capturing the Flag; Building a Future Through Opportunity
University of the South (Sewanee)
